methodology.description: Each plugin is run in isolation against identical fixture files containing known-vulnerable and known-safe code patterns. Violations are mapped to exported functions to calculate True Positives (correct detections), False Negatives (missed vulnerabilities), False Positives (safe code incorrectly flagged), and True Negatives (safe code correctly passed).

vuln_redos_evil.message: Capturing group number 1 is defined but never used.

This quantifier can reach itself via the loop '(a+)+'. Using any string accepted by /a+/, this can be exploited to cause at least polynomial backtracking. This is going to cause exponential backtracking resulting in exponential worst-case runtime behavior.
The quantifier 'a+' can exchange characters (a) with '(a+)+'. This makes the capturing group misleading, because the quantifier will capture fewer characters than its pattern suggests.

exampleViolations.message: Capturing group number 1 is defined but never used.

This quantifier can reach itself via the loop '(a+)+'. Using any string accepted by /a+/, this can be exploited to cause at least polynomial backtracking. This is going to cause exponential backtracking resulting in exponential worst-case runtime behavior.
The quantifier 'a+' can exchange characters (a) with '(a+)+'. This makes the capturing group misleading, because the quantifier will capture fewer characters than its pattern suggests.

safe_path_regex.message: Unexpected character class ranges '[a-zA-Z0-9_]'. Use '\w' instead.
The character class(es) '[a-zA-Z0-9._-]' can be simplified using the `i` flag.

safe_regex_simple.message: The quantifier '[^\s@]+' can exchange characters with '[^\s@]+'. Using any string accepted by /\.+/, this can be exploited to cause at least polynomial backtracking.

exampleFalsePositives.message: Unexpected character class ranges '[a-zA-Z0-9_]'. Use '\w' instead.

vuln_sql_string_concat.message:
CWE-89 OWASP:A03-Injection CVSS:9.8 | Unsafe SQL query detected. Variable interpolation found. | CRITICAL [SOC2,PCI-DSS,NIST-CSF]
   Fix: Use parameterized queries ($1, $2) instead of string concatenation. | https://node-postgres.com/features/queries#parameterized-queries

vuln_sql_template_literal.message:
Unsafe SQL query construction detected (template literal). | CRITICAL
   Fix: Use parameterized queries ($1, $2) instead of interpolating values. | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/SQL_Injection

vuln_sql_dynamic_column.message:
Unsafe SQL query construction detected (template literal). | CRITICAL
   Fix: Use parameterized queries ($1, $2) instead of interpolating values. | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/SQL_Injection

vuln_sql_conditional.message:
Unsafe SQL query construction detected (template literal). | CRITICAL
   Fix: Use parameterized queries ($1, $2) instead of interpolating values. | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/SQL_Injection

vuln_cmd_exec_concat.message:
CWE-78 OWASP:A05-Injection CVSS:9.8 | Command injection detected | CRITICAL [SOC2,PCI-DSS,ISO27001,NIST-CSF]
   Fix: Use execFile/spawn with {shell: false} and array args | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Command_Injection

vuln_cmd_exec_template.message:
CWE-78 OWASP:A05-Injection CVSS:9.8 | Command injection detected | CRITICAL [SOC2,PCI-DSS,ISO27001,NIST-CSF]
   Fix: Use execFile/spawn with {shell: false} and array args | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Command_Injection

vuln_cmd_spawn_shell.message:
CWE-78 OWASP:A05-Injection CVSS:9.8 | Command injection detected | CRITICAL [SOC2,PCI-DSS,ISO27001,NIST-CSF]
   Fix: Use execFile/spawn with {shell: false} and array args | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Command_Injection

vuln_path_join.message:
CWE-22 OWASP:A01-Broken CVSS:7.5 | Path traversal vulnerability | HIGH [SOC2,PCI-DSS,HIPAA,ISO27001]
   Fix: Use path.resolve() with validation | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Path_Traversal

CWE-22 OWASP:A01-Broken CVSS:7.5 | File path from user input - path traversal vulnerability | HIGH [SOC2,PCI-DSS,HIPAA,ISO27001]
   Fix: Validate and sanitize file paths, use allowlists | https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/22.html

vuln_path_concat.message:
CWE-22 OWASP:A01-Broken CVSS:7.5 | Path traversal vulnerability | HIGH [SOC2,PCI-DSS,HIPAA,ISO27001]
   Fix: Use path.resolve() with validation | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Path_Traversal

CWE-770 | File operations without size limits | MEDIUM
   Fix: Validate file size before operations | https://nodejs.org/api/fs.html

CWE-643 | XPath injection vulnerability detected | HIGH
   Fix: Use parameterized XPath construction with input validation | https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/643.html

vuln_path_no_validation.message:
CWE-22 OWASP:A01-Broken CVSS:7.5 | Path traversal vulnerability | HIGH [SOC2,PCI-DSS,HIPAA,ISO27001]
   Fix: Validate directory is within allowed paths | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Path_Traversal

vuln_path_url_pathname.message:
CWE-22 OWASP:A01-Broken CVSS:7.5 | Path traversal vulnerability | HIGH [SOC2,PCI-DSS,HIPAA,ISO27001]
   Fix: Use path.resolve() with validation | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Path_Traversal

vuln_creds_db_password.message:
CWE-798 OWASP:A04-Cryptographic CVSS:9.8 | Hard-coded Common password detected | CRITICAL [SOC2,PCI-DSS,HIPAA,GDPR]
   Fix: Use environment variable: process.env.USER or secret management service | https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/798.html

CWE-489 | Debug endpoint exposed without authentication | HIGH
   Fix: Remove debug endpoints from production or add authentication | https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/489.html

CWE-798 OWASP:A07-Auth CVSS:9.8 | Hardcoded credentials detected in database connection. | CRITICAL [SOC2,PCI-DSS,ISO27001,NIST-CSF]
   Fix: Use environment variables (process.env.DB_PASSWORD) instead of hardcoding secrets. | https://owasp.org/www-community/vulnerabilities/Use_of_hard-coded_password

vuln_creds_api_key.message:
CWE-798 OWASP:A04-Cryptographic CVSS:9.8 | Hard-coded API key detected | CRITICAL [SOC2,PCI-DSS,HIPAA,GDPR]
   Fix: Use environment variable: process.env.API_KEY or secret management service | https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/798.html

vuln_creds_aws.message:
CWE-798 OWASP:A04-Cryptographic CVSS:9.8 | Hard-coded AWS access key detected | CRITICAL [SOC2,PCI-DSS,HIPAA,GDPR]
   Fix: Use environment variable: process.env.ACCESS_KEY_ID or secret management service | https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/798.html

CWE-798 OWASP:A02-Cryptographic CVSS:8.5 | Hardcoded API key "wJalrXUtnF..." detected. Use environment variables instead. | CRITICAL [SOC2,PCI-DSS,GDPR]
   Fix: Use environment variable: apiKey: process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY | https://sdk.vercel.ai/docs/ai-sdk-core/settings

CWE-798 OWASP:A04-Cryptographic CVSS:9.8 | Hard-coded Secret key detected | CRITICAL [SOC2,PCI-DSS,HIPAA,GDPR]
   Fix: Use environment variable: process.env.SECRET_ACCESS_KEY or secret management service | https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/798.html

vuln_creds_jwt_secret.message:
CWE-613 OWASP:A07-Authentication CVSS:5.4 | JWT without expiration is valid forever, increasing exposure window | MEDIUM
   Fix: Add expiresIn: "1h" or exp claim to payload | https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8725

CWE-326 OWASP:A04-Cryptographic CVSS:5.9 | JWT secret must be at least 32 characters (256 bits) for HS256 | HIGH
   Fix: Generate a secret with: crypto.randomBytes(32).toString("hex") | https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8725

CWE-798 OWASP:A04-Cryptographic CVSS:9.8 | Secret key hardcoded in source code can be extracted from repositories | HIGH [SOC2,PCI-DSS,HIPAA,GDPR]
   Fix: Use process.env.JWT_SECRET or secure secret management | https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/798.html

vuln_jwt_alg_none.message:
CWE-326 OWASP:A04-Cryptographic CVSS:5.9 | JWT secret is too weak and can be brute-forced | HIGH
   Fix: Use crypto.randomBytes(32).toString("hex") for secrets | https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8725

CWE-798 OWASP:A04-Cryptographic CVSS:9.8 | Secret key hardcoded in source code can be extracted from repositories | HIGH [SOC2,PCI-DSS,HIPAA,GDPR]
   Fix: Use process.env.JWT_SECRET or secure secret management | https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/798.html

CWE-347 | Including "none" in algorithms array allows unsigned tokens | CRITICAL
   Fix: Remove "none" from the algorithms array | https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-23540

vuln_jwt_no_algorithm.message:
CWE-757 | JWT verification without explicit algorithms trusts the token header | HIGH
   Fix: Add algorithms: ["RS256"] or algorithms: ["ES256"] to options | https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8725

vuln_jwt_no_expiry.message:
CWE-613 OWASP:A07-Authentication CVSS:5.4 | JWT without expiration is valid forever, increasing exposure window | MEDIUM
   Fix: Add expiresIn: "1h" or exp claim to payload | https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8725

vuln_xss_innerhtml.message:
CWE-79 OWASP:A05-Injection CVSS:6.1 | Assigning to innerHTML with variable "userContent" can execute malicious scripts. This is a critical XSS vulnerability. | CRITICAL [SOC2,PCI-DSS,GDPR,ISO27001]
   Fix: Use textContent for text, or sanitize with DOMPurify.sanitize() before assignment. | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/xss/

vuln_xss_document_write.message:
CWE-116 | Simple replace() calls are insufficient for sanitization | MEDIUM
   Fix: Use comprehensive sanitization libraries | https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/116.html

CWE-116 | Simple replace() calls are insufficient for sanitization | MEDIUM
   Fix: Use comprehensive sanitization libraries | https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/116.html

vuln_xss_eval.message:
CWE-502 OWASP:A08-Software CVSS:9.8 | eval() used for deserialization (code execution vulnerability) | CRITICAL
   Fix: Use JSON.parse() or safe deserialization libraries | https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/502.html

CWE-95 OWASP:A05-Injection CVSS:9.8 | eval() can be refactored to safer alternative | HIGH [SOC2,PCI-DSS,ISO27001]
   Fix: Remove eval entirely | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Code_Injection

CWE-95 OWASP:A05-Injection CVSS:9.8 | Using eval with dynamic input can execute arbitrary code. This is a critical security vulnerability. | CRITICAL [SOC2,PCI-DSS,ISO27001]
   Fix: Use safe alternatives like JSON.parse() for data, or refactor to avoid dynamic code execution. | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Code_Injection

vuln_xss_new_function.message:
CWE-502 OWASP:A08-Software CVSS:9.8 | Function constructor used with untrusted data | CRITICAL
   Fix: Avoid Function constructor with user input | https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Function

CWE-95 OWASP:A05-Injection CVSS:9.8 | eval() can be refactored to safer alternative | HIGH [SOC2,PCI-DSS,ISO27001]
   Fix: Arrow function or regular function | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Code_Injection

CWE-95 OWASP:A05-Injection CVSS:9.8 | Using Function constructor with dynamic input can execute arbitrary code. This is a critical security vulnerability. | CRITICAL [SOC2,PCI-DSS,ISO27001]
   Fix: Use safe alternatives like JSON.parse() for data, or refactor to avoid dynamic code execution. | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Code_Injection

vuln_proto_bracket.message:
CWE-915 OWASP:A01-Broken CVSS:9.8 | Object injection/Prototype pollution (incl. model/tool outputs) | HIGH [SOC2,PCI-DSS,ISO27001]
   Fix: Use Map or property whitelisting | https://portswigger.net/web-security/prototype-pollution

vuln_proto_nested.message:
CWE-915 OWASP:A01-Broken CVSS:9.8 | Object injection/Prototype pollution (incl. model/tool outputs) | MEDIUM [SOC2,PCI-DSS,ISO27001]
   Fix: Use Map or property whitelisting | https://portswigger.net/web-security/prototype-pollution

CWE-915 OWASP:A01-Broken CVSS:9.8 | Object injection/Prototype pollution (incl. model/tool outputs) | HIGH [SOC2,PCI-DSS,ISO27001]
   Fix: Use Map or property whitelisting | https://portswigger.net/web-security/prototype-pollution

CWE-915 OWASP:A01-Broken CVSS:9.8 | Object injection/Prototype pollution (incl. model/tool outputs) | MEDIUM [SOC2,PCI-DSS,ISO27001]
   Fix: Use Map or property whitelisting | https://portswigger.net/web-security/prototype-pollution

vuln_proto_assign.message:
CWE-502 OWASP:A08-Software CVSS:9.8 | Deserializing untrusted input (incl. LLM/MCP responses) without validation | HIGH
   Fix: Schema-validate and size-cap before deserialization; reject unknown fields | https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/502.html

CWE-611 OWASP:A05-Injection CVSS:9.1 | XML from untrusted source without validation | HIGH
   Fix: Validate and sanitize XML input before parsing | https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/XML_External_Entity_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet.html

vuln_random_token.message:
CWE-338 OWASP:A04-Cryptographic CVSS:5.3 | Math.random() is not cryptographically secure. It uses a PRNG that can be predicted. Never use it for tokens, keys, passwords, or any security-sensitive values. | CRITICAL
   Fix: Use crypto.randomBytes() or crypto.randomUUID() instead | https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Cryptographic_Storage_Cheat_Sheet.html#secure-random-number-generation

vuln_random_session.message:
CWE-338 OWASP:A04-Cryptographic CVSS:5.3 | Math.random() is not cryptographically secure. It uses a PRNG that can be predicted. Never use it for tokens, keys, passwords, or any security-sensitive values. | CRITICAL
   Fix: Use crypto.randomBytes() or crypto.randomUUID() instead | https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Cryptographic_Storage_Cheat_Sheet.html#secure-random-number-generation

vuln_crypto_md5.message:
CWE-327 OWASP:A04-Cryptographic CVSS:7.5 | Use of weak hash algorithm: MD5. MD5 is cryptographically broken and unsuitable for security purposes. | CRITICAL [PCI-DSS,HIPAA,ISO27001,NIST-CSF]
   Fix: Replace with sha256: crypto.createHash("sha256").update(data) | https://owasp.org/www-community/vulnerabilities/Weak_Cryptography

vuln_crypto_sha1.message:
CWE-327 OWASP:A04-Cryptographic CVSS:7.5 | Use of weak hash algorithm: SHA-1. SHA-1 is cryptographically broken and unsuitable for security purposes. | CRITICAL [PCI-DSS,HIPAA,ISO27001,NIST-CSF]
   Fix: Replace with sha256: crypto.createHash("sha256").update(data) | https://owasp.org/www-community/vulnerabilities/Weak_Cryptography

vuln_crypto_des.message:
CWE-327 OWASP:A04-Cryptographic CVSS:7.5 | Use of weak cipher algorithm: DES. DES has known vulnerabilities and should not be used. | CRITICAL [PCI-DSS,HIPAA,ISO27001,NIST-CSF]
   Fix: Replace with aes-256-gcm: crypto.createCipheriv("aes-256-gcm", key, iv) | https://owasp.org/www-community/vulnerabilities/Weak_Cryptography

CWE-798 OWASP:A04-Cryptographic CVSS:9.8 | Hard-coded Common password detected | CRITICAL [SOC2,PCI-DSS,HIPAA,GDPR]
   Fix: Use environment variable: process.env.API_KEY or secret management service | https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/798.html

vuln_timing_direct.message:
CWE-208 | Secret comparison with === can leak timing information | HIGH
   Fix: Use crypto.timingSafeEqual(Buffer.from(a), Buffer.from(b)) | https://nodejs.org/api/crypto.html#cryptotimingsafeequala-b

vuln_timing_token.message:
CWE-208 | Secret comparison with === can leak timing information | HIGH
   Fix: Use crypto.timingSafeEqual(Buffer.from(a), Buffer.from(b)) | https://nodejs.org/api/crypto.html#cryptotimingsafeequala-b

vuln_nosql_mongo.message:
CWE-943 OWASP:A03-Injection CVSS:9.8 | User input "username" is used directly in MongoDB query. Attackers can inject operators like { $ne: null } to bypass authentication. | CRITICAL
   Fix: Wrap user input with explicit $eq operator: { field: { $eq: sanitize(value) } } | https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/latest/4-Web_Application_Security_Testing/07-Input_Validation_Testing/05.6-Testing_for_NoSQL_Injection

vuln_nosql_where.message:
CWE-943 OWASP:A03-Injection CVSS:9.8 | User input "userInput" is used directly in MongoDB query. Attackers can inject operators like { $ne: null } to bypass authentication. | CRITICAL
   Fix: Wrap user input with explicit $eq operator: { field: { $eq: sanitize(value) } } | https://owasp.org/www-project-web-security-testing-guide/latest/4-Web_Application_Security_Testing/07-Input_Validation_Testing/05.6-Testing_for_NoSQL_Injection

vuln_ssrf_fetch.message:
CWE-918 OWASP:A01-Broken CVSS:9.1 | HTTP request with potentially user-controlled URL. An attacker could access internal services. | HIGH
   Fix: Validate URL against an allowlist of permitted hosts before making the request. | https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Server_Side_Request_Forgery_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet.html

vuln_ssrf_axios.message:
CWE-918 OWASP:A01-Broken CVSS:9.1 | HTTP request with potentially user-controlled URL. An attacker could access internal services. | HIGH
   Fix: Validate URL against an allowlist of permitted hosts before making the request. | https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Server_Side_Request_Forgery_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet.html

vuln_redirect.message:
CWE-601 | Unvalidated redirect detected - user-controlled URL | HIGH
   Fix: Whitelist allowed domains or validate redirect target | https://owasp.org/www-community/vulnerabilities/Unvalidated_Redirects_and_Forwards

vuln_redos_evil.message:
CWE-400 OWASP:A06-Insecure CVSS:7.5 | ReDoS vulnerability detected | CRITICAL
   Fix: Restructure regex to avoid nested quantifiers | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Regular_expression_Denial_of_Service_-_ReDoS

CWE-400 OWASP:A06-Insecure CVSS:7.5 | Nested Quantifiers: Nested quantifiers like (a+)+, (a*)*, (a?)? cause exponential backtracking | CRITICAL
   Fix: Use atomic groups (?>...) or restructure to avoid nesting | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Regular_expression_Denial_of_Service_-_ReDoS

vuln_redos_user.message:
CWE-400 OWASP:A06-Insecure CVSS:7.5 | ReDoS vulnerability detected | HIGH
   Fix: Pre-defined RegExp constants | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Regular_expression_Denial_of_Service_-_ReDoS

CWE-400 OWASP:A06-Insecure CVSS:7.5 | User input in regex without escaping: User input in regex pattern can lead to ReDoS or injection attacks | HIGH
   Fix: Escape special characters before using in regex | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Regular_expression_Denial_of_Service_-_ReDoS

exampleViolations.message:
CWE-89 OWASP:A03-Injection CVSS:9.8 | Unsafe SQL query detected. Variable interpolation found. | CRITICAL [SOC2,PCI-DSS,NIST-CSF]
   Fix: Use parameterized queries ($1, $2) instead of string concatenation. | https://node-postgres.com/features/queries#parameterized-queries

Unsafe SQL query construction detected (template literal). | CRITICAL
   Fix: Use parameterized queries ($1, $2) instead of interpolating values. | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/SQL_Injection

Unsafe SQL query construction detected (template literal). | CRITICAL
   Fix: Use parameterized queries ($1, $2) instead of interpolating values. | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/SQL_Injection

Unsafe SQL query construction detected (template literal). | CRITICAL
   Fix: Use parameterized queries ($1, $2) instead of interpolating values. | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/SQL_Injection

CWE-78 OWASP:A05-Injection CVSS:9.8 | Command injection detected | CRITICAL [SOC2,PCI-DSS,ISO27001,NIST-CSF]
   Fix: Use execFile/spawn with {shell: false} and array args | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Command_Injection

CWE-78 OWASP:A05-Injection CVSS:9.8 | Command injection detected | CRITICAL [SOC2,PCI-DSS,ISO27001,NIST-CSF]
   Fix: Use execFile/spawn with {shell: false} and array args | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Command_Injection

CWE-78 OWASP:A05-Injection CVSS:9.8 | Command injection detected | CRITICAL [SOC2,PCI-DSS,ISO27001,NIST-CSF]
   Fix: Use execFile/spawn with {shell: false} and array args | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Command_Injection

CWE-78 OWASP:A05-Injection CVSS:9.8 | Command injection detected | CRITICAL [SOC2,PCI-DSS,ISO27001,NIST-CSF]
   Fix: Use execFile/spawn with {shell: false} and array args | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Command_Injection

CWE-22 OWASP:A01-Broken CVSS:7.5 | Path traversal vulnerability | HIGH [SOC2,PCI-DSS,HIPAA,ISO27001]
   Fix: Use path.resolve() with validation | https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/Path_Traversal

CWE-22 OWASP:A01-Broken CVSS:7.5 | File path from user input - path traversal vulnerability | HIGH [SOC2,PCI-DSS,HIPAA,ISO27001]
   Fix: Validate and sanitize file paths, use allowlists | https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/22.html
